definition: to spread throughout the entire country

sentences.english: Open doors can provide enough draft so that a fire can run wild.
sentences.chinese: 打开门会提供足够的气流更会使火势蔓延。

sentences.english: The flames appear to have spread from the direction of a neighbouring cow farm.
sentences.chinese: 火似乎是从邻近的一个养牛的牧场方向蔓延过来的。

sentences.english: Tablets are newer and just beginning to pervade the market.
sentences.chinese: 平板电脑较新且刚刚开始蔓延于市场。

sentences.english: The further spread of resistance to artemisinins makes progress fragile.
sentences.chinese: 进一步蔓延的青蒿素耐药问题使进展变得脆弱。

sentences.english: Oat bran was porphyrizd into cell-level ultramicro-power.
sentences.chinese: 正沿支气管蔓延的燕麦细胞癌。

sentences.english: The fire is sprawling in all directions.
I turned into the dirt road and followed it through encroaching trees and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我转上土路，在蔓延至路面的树木和灌木间穿行。

sentences.english: We’re in Afghanistan to prevent a cancer from once again spreading through that country.
sentences.chinese: 我们在阿富汗是为了防止毒瘤再次向这个国家蔓延。

sentences.english: Within a week the fleshy leaves started to whither and, weirdly, turn a bit mushy.
sentences.chinese: 在一周内，肉质叶开始蔓延，奇怪地变成糊状。

sentences.english: On the palate, the flavours open up unrestrainedly and not without a certain balance and roundness which overwhelm us.
sentences.chinese: 品尝的时候，味道持久地在口中蔓延开，平衡而圆润。

sentences.english: Smoke began to spread across the freeway like fog.
sentences.chinese: 烟开始像浓雾一样在高速公路上蔓延。

sentences.english: The fires were spreading in all directions in the dry conditions.
sentences.chinese: 大火在干燥的天气下正向四面八方蔓延。

sentences.english: The disease Streptococcus suis spreads very fast.
sentences.chinese: 猪链球疾病蔓延速度非常快。

sentences.english: Tongues of flame leaped up the stairway.
sentences.chinese: 火舌沿楼梯迅速向上蔓延。

sentences.english: Syphilis spread from coastal opening cities to inland urban area, then to rural area.
sentences.chinese: 由沿海开放城市向内陆城市再向农村地区蔓延。

sentences.english: The jungle was creeping back to its old strongholds.
sentences.chinese: 莽丛密林一步一步地蔓延到了古老的城堡。

definition: to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
to grow (usually of abstract things)/to yield/to develop
to breed/to flourish/to cause/to provoke/to create
(lit. and fig.) to permeate/to seep into/(of a product, idea etc) to penetrate (in a population)/(of hostile forces) to infiltrate/(chemistry) osmosis
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
